title: Installing Windows XP with no DVD, USB, or Floppy!

forumNotes.author: Yoav
forumNotes.content:
I have this sony vaio laptop, and the good people at sony decided not to give this drive the ability to boot from a usb device (external dvd or floppy)  

Unfortunately the DVD drive that was built in BROKE, and I need to install windows on this laptop using a brand new hard drive.  

Any ideas?  

I can't boot from the windows dvd, I can't boot from a floppy, the drive is totally empty so I can't put anything on it.  

I CAN however, connect it to another computer and format it, I thought I could make it into a MSDOS bootable drive (like when you format a floppy) but windows does not allow it on a drive this size.  

Is there a program I can use to install the i386 files on this drive and make it bootable from a different computer?  

HELP please!

forumNotes.author: ilko
forumNotes.content:
Connect it to another computer with adapter.  
Run winnt32.exe:  

winnt32.exe /noreboot /makelocalsource /syspart:F: /tempdrive:F:   

where F: is the first primary partition on it, made active.  
Add /unattend:winnt.sif if you have customized answer file in your source. Winnt32.exe is in I386 in your XP setup source/CD.  

This will copy all Setup files to the laptop's hard disk, so when you plug it back in Setup will start just as if started from a CD.  

BTW are you sure it cannot boot from USB? How old is it? How did you prepare/format the USB stick/disk which you used to test?

forumNotes.author: yggdrasil
forumNotes.content:
@  
I created a script for a time ago that creates different "setup folders" to be used in CD/DVD multiboot creations. In fact, you can also use winnt.sif so you don't need to set in your product-key and answer boring questions.  

Part of my commands in script:  
ShellExecute,hide,"%pFileBox2%\\i386\\winnt32.exe"," /noreboot /unattend:%Temp%\\bootini\\winnt.sif"  

I must admitt that @ilko solved it very smart using this switches "/makelocalsource /syspart:F: /tempdrive:F: :smile:   

yggdrasil

forumNotes.author: sanbarrow

By the way - this procedure works for 2k, XP and 2k3.  
The machine used to prepare the disk must have lower or same Windows version.  

preparing XP-setup on a 2k host works  
preparing 2k-setup on XP host does not work  

if you only have a Vista-host you can still prepare 2k, XP, 2k3 setup-disks with mentioned command if you use a virtual machine

forumNotes.author: JonF
forumNotes.content:
> I've actually not tried with a usb stick but with an external USB DVD Drive, in any case, there is no option like it in the bios, only internal dvd, internal hd or network boot.
Glad you got it fixed.  

For future reference, many BIOSs do not present the USB boot option unless there is a bootable USB drive plugged in. Your Vaio might boot from a USB flash drive or hard drive if you plug it in before booting.
